intro: Astragalus falcigerus, commonly known as the sicklepod milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, legume-like pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Astragalus falcigerus is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert scrub ecosystems.
